title: 78/267. International Day for the Prevention of and Fight against All Forms of Transnational Organized Crime

paragraphs.1: Decides to declare 15 November the International Day for the Prevention of and Fight against All Forms of Transnational Organized Crime, in order to raise awareness of the threats posed by all forms of transnational organized crime and to enhance international cooperation in this regard;
paragraphs.2: Invites all Member States, the organizations of the United Nations system and other global and regional organizations, within existing resources, as well as other relevant stakeholders, including civil society, the private sector, academia and the media, to commemorate the International Day in an appropriate manner, including through educational and public awareness-raising activities, and to share best practices in this regard;
paragraphs.4: Stresses that the cost of all activities that may arise from the implementation of the present resolution shall be met from voluntary contributions;
paragraphs.5: Requests the Secretary-General to bring the present resolution to the attention of all Member States, the organizations of the United Nations system and civil society organizations for appropriate observance of the International Day.
